definitions.definition: remove (someone) from a place of danger to a safe place.
examples: several families were evacuated from their homes

definitions.definition: leave or cause the occupants to leave (a place of danger).
examples: fire alarms forced staff to evacuate the building
synonyms: escape from "they evacuated the bombed town"

examples: the last American troops evacuated the Canal Zone

definitions.definition: remove air, water, or other contents from (a container).
examples: when it springs a leak, evacuate the pond

definitions.definition: empty (the bowels or another bodily organ).
examples: empty (out), void, open, move, purge; Moredefecate "patients couldn't evacuate their bowels"expel, eject, discharge, excrete, void, empty (out), vomit up "he evacuated the contents of his stomach"Moredefecate patients couldn't evacuate their bowelsexpel, eject, discharge, excrete, void, empty (out), vomit up he evacuated the contents of his stomach

definitions.definition: discharge (feces or other matter) from the body.
examples: expel, eject, discharge, excrete, void, empty (out), vomit up he evacuated the contents of his stomach

definitions.definition: deprive (something) of contents, value, or force.
examples: he evacuated time and history of significance
